required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Center, Randomized, Double-Blind,Placebo-Controlled Efficacy and Safety Study of Testosterone Gel 1.62% for the Treatment of Hypogonadal Men

brief_summary.textblock: Demonstrate efficacy and safety of Testosterone Gel 1.62% for the treatment of hypogonadal men

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects on Testosterone Treatment Achieving Target Range for Testosterone Cav (Time-averaged Concentration Over the Dosing Interval of 24 Hours) on Day 112
primary_outcome.description: Cav results were required to fall within the normal range of 300-1000 ng/dL. Success in the study was defined as >=75% of subjects on active treatment within the normal serum testosterone concentration range of 300-1000 ng/dL. In addition, the lower bound of the 95% CI was to be not less than 65% based on the Day 112 Parmacokinetics (PK) results

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects on Testosterone Treatment Achieving Target Range for Testosterone Cav (Time-averaged Concentration Over the Dosing Interval of 24 Hours) on Day 14
secondary_outcome.description: Cav results were required to fall within the normal range of 300-1000 ng/dL at Day 14. Success was defined as >=75% of subjects on active treatment within the normal serum testosterone concentration range of 300-1000 ng/dL. In addition, the lower bound of the 95% CI was to be not less than 65% based on the Day 14 PK results

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects on Testosterone Treatment Achieving Target Range for Testosterone Cav (Time-averaged Concentration Over the Dosing Interval of 24 Hours) on Day 56
secondary_outcome.description: Cav results were required to fall within the normal range of 300-1000 ng/dL at Day 56. Success was defined as >=75% of subjects on active treatment within the normal serum testosterone concentration range of 300-1000 ng/dL. In addition, the lower bound of the 95% CI was to be not less than 65% based on the Day 56 PK results

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects on Testosterone Treatment Achieving Target Range for Testosterone Cav (Time-averaged Concentration Over the Dosing Interval of 24 Hours) on Day 182
secondary_outcome.description: Cav results were required to fall within the normal range of 300-1000 ng/dL at Day 182. Success was defined as >=75% of subjects on active treatment within the normal serum testosterone concentration range of 300-1000 ng/dL. In addition, the lower bound of the 95% CI was to be not less than 65% based on the Day 182 PK results.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Achieving Target Range for Testosterone Cav During the Open-label Period at Day 266.
secondary_outcome.description: The success at Day 266 was defined as >=75% of subjects within the normal serum total testosterone concentration range of 300-1000 ng/dL. The Lower bounds of the 95% CI was to be not less than 65%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Achieving Target Range for Testosterone Cav During the Open-label Period at Day 364.
secondary_outcome.description: The success at Day 364 was defined as >=75% of subjects within the normal serum total testosterone concentration range of 300-1000 ng/dL. The Lower bounds of the 95% CI was to be not less than 65%.

intervention.description: Testosterone gel 1.62% contains 1.62% testosterone gel as active ingredient.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Low T males 18 - 80 years of age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Normal T levels
- Elevated Prostatic Specific Antigen (PSA)

responsible_party.name_title: Michael Miller, Pharm. D Project Director

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited in 63 centers in US from February 2007 to April 2007 in clinics. The study was designed with a double-blind period of 182 days on Placebo or Androgel 1.62% followed by an 182 days open-label period on Androgel 1.62%.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All subjects started at a daily dose of 2.50 g testosterone gel 1.62% or matching placebo on Day 1. Within 2 days of each of visits (D14, D28 and D42), the dose was titrated up or down in 1.25 g steps if necessary, based on pre-specified normal range criteria, by an unblinded reviewer. The minimum and maximum daily doses were 1.25 g and 5.0 g.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo comparator administered during the Double-Blind period only

group.title: T-Gel 1.62%
group.description: Testosterone (T): daily dose of 2.50 g testosterone gel 1.62% administered during the Double-Blind period and the Open-Label period.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo comparator administered during the Double-Blind period only

group.title: T-Gel 1.62%
group.description: Testosterone (T): daily dose of 2.50 g testosterone gel 1.62% administered during the Double-Blind period and the Open-Label period.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.description: The Baseline analysis is presented on the Full analysis set.

outcome.title: Percentage of Subjects on Testosterone Treatment Achieving Target Range for Testosterone Cav (Time-averaged Concentration Over the Dosing Interval of 24 Hours) on Day 112
outcome.description: Cav results were required to fall within the normal range of 300-1000 ng/dL. Success in the study was defined as >=75% of subjects on active treatment within the normal serum testosterone concentration range of 300-1000 ng/dL. In addition, the lower bound of the 95% CI was to be not less than 65% based on the Day 112 Parmacokinetics (PK) results
outcome.population: The analysis was done on the Full analysis sample defined as the subjects who were included in the Safety Sample and who had data for at least one post-Baseline assessment of any efficacy measurement up to and including Day 182 (double-blind period). The number correspond to the number of subjects having a measurement at Day 112;

measure.population: The analysis was done on the Full analysis sample defined as the subjects who were included in the Safety Sample and who had data for at least one post-Baseline assessment of any efficacy measurement up to and including Day 182 (double-blind period). outcome.population: The analysis was done on the Full analysis set with patients included in the double-blind period with a measurement at Day 14.

group.title: Continuing Active T-Gel 1.62% (CA)
group.description: Testosterone gel 1.62% given during the Double-Blind period and Testosterone gel 1.62% given during the Open-label period.

group.title: Formerly Placebo (FP)
group.description: Placebo group given during the Double-Blind period and Testosterone gel 1.62% given during the Open-label period.

group.title: Combined (CA and FP)
group.description: Testosterone gel 1.62% is given to all the subjects entering the Open-label period.

reported_events.time_frame: The adverse events presented were collected from start of drug treatment to the end of the double-blind treatment period (from Day 0 to Day 182).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo comparator administered during the Double-Blind period only

group.title: T-Gel 1.62%
group.description: Testosterone (T): daily dose of 2.50 g testosterone gel 1.62% administered during the Double-Blind period and the Open-Label period.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Spinal cord and nerve root disorders

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: At 60 days prior to submitting or presenting a manuscript or other materials relating to the Study to a publisher, reviewer, or other outside persons, the Site shall provide to Sponsor a copy and allow Sponsor 60 days to review and comment.
